title: Great service re phone call
body: Very helpful with my prescriptions  we have just joined the surgery   Very good my wife also seen doc and can only say excellent service very caring

title: Fantastic care in maternity & neonatal wards
body:
We received exceptional care during a very busy period in July 2022. I had a very long labour and was then considered high risk. The maternity team ensured a calm birthing environment. Unfortunately, we did require intervention but our options were discussed and our wishes were adhered to. Our daughter was born after an emergency c section and required some assistance breathing and had to be moved to neonatal intensive care. The staff on the maternity ward were so kind as I was inevitably very upset and scared about what that meant for our newborn. They were extremely busy but the support was incredible.
I received a lot of support with breastfeeding from both the maternity and neonatal team. I don’t think it would’ve been possible without their support and I am eternally grateful. 
All of the staff we encountered during our time there went above and beyond what I expected and in difficult circumstances with it being a very busy time. 
I owe everything to both the maternity and neonatal staff. Thank you for saving our daughter!
Although we didn’t have the birth we perhaps wanted, the experience was made a positive one because of the support we had after our daughters difficult start to life. She is now 7months old and thriving. 
I also received birth trauma counselling and this was so beneficial for me to process everything that had happened. 
The birth debrief was also so helpful to understand what had happened and why. Again, I am very grateful for this. It helped me understand things I didn’t know or had forgotten in the haze of our labour and birth.
Thank you to everyone who helped and supported us during this difficult time!

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great A E staff and doctors
body: Have to say a big thank you to the girl on reception in a e at 4am in the morning  but when I left to go to acute assessment ward everything failed no communication no heating no blankets felt failed

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Responsible i kind doctors
body: I'm writing from the perspective of a mother. Both of my kids are getting sick constantly since November 22. I had to go to A&E two times but majority of great support we got here, at The Cedar Brook. Of course there are many things that require improvements but all of the stuff at surgery are trying their very best to help their patients and to unjust to difficult times. So far I can't complain too much. I'm also registered there and I got some needed help too. Other family members, all of them with serious health problems, always get appointments and help there too. I just hope it can be easier to get blood tests and better access to women doctors.

title: Ridiculous Waste of Time
body: After being unable to secure a doctor’s appointment on multiple occasions, I visited the walk in centre under the recommendation of the GP reception staff. I was forced to wait nearly 4 hours(!) to be seen. When I was finally seen by a nurse, they recommended blood tests and a scan, which they said they didn’t have the authority to refer me for! I was then sent back(!) to the GP, for them to perform the same checks and recommend the same exact processes. What exactly is the point of this centre, if they cannot provide the basic services that doctors can? Surely they are meant to relieve the pressure on GP practices, when appointments there are impossible to come by! The painful hours spent waiting in this centre I will unfortunately not get back. Avoid wasting your time here.

title: Incredible compassion
body: Called 111, had call back and then appointment. I waited for two hours but the staff were amazing. Kind, compassionate and working under incredible pressure.

title: No communication
body: My husband has been in Waveney Ward for over a week and there has been a failure of communication as to his treatment, rehabilitation and forward treatment - very worry as his wife

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Proud of our Nhs
body: I was referred by my Gp last July for a ct scan and a urgent lung cancer clinic appointment, I was told that I didn't have cancer but I was suffering with Bronchiectasis the scan also showed I had a 6.6 cm triple a Aneurysm. I was referred to the vascular department and they were concerned about my lungs so I was referred to several different clinics all over Cornwall (Launceston Bodmin Newquay Foxhole Treliske ) at the clinic for Thoracic medicine I was told I had smoking related Copd ( I quit smoking 25 years ago ) they put me on a permanent inhaler and an Active Cycle of Breathing Techniques. The vascular Surgeons decided that open surgery was not an option so I was booked in for an Evar procedure on the 2nd March. When they took me into the theatre it was jaw dropping I thought I was on the set of a Science Fiction film. My life saving operation went well and I would like to thank everyone concerned in my journey including the care I received in the Epoc aftercare department. Well done and thank you Rch Treliske you did the Nhs proud.

title: The best care
body: I went there on the 4 march the moment you walk in the nurse takes your temperature she is so cheerful then refers you to the right department from there everyone is so helpful and they take good care of you , I can say a bad word about AE and all departments.nurses doctors are so helpful they make you not a patient but a person thank you all

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: Out of control the worst experience
body: Absolutely one big joke. I'm 37 weeks pregnant I came to a&e department with my husband as he suddenly lost his avability to see anything. He had a huge headache every day since over a month his been told by doctors to take only paracetamol as everything is ok. Now he can't see. We have been waiting already 6h just for the blood and pressure be taken. Minimum waiting time 4h we have been told. There is so many people in pain around and doctors seem to have a time for everything. Noone is rushing everything is done super slow even walk. This is just a joke. Noo e can tell us how long from now we will be still waiting could be another 6h. Other thin is the ho else's peopke were here doing a party drinking alcohol playing music shouting. Nothing was done about it receptionist seemed absolutely fi e with it, security wasn't even called. It's so awfull what's happening in here I feel like people can lictuarly die here and nothing will be done really.  Do not come to this hospital.

title: Very informative
body:
I felt very comfortable during my review 
Very well informed by the clinical pharmacist 
The treatment was explained very well and found the clinician easy to converse with

title: Appalling senior nurse behaviour
body: Whilst I was sitting in A&E to be seen. A woman walked in with her adult son who was having difficulty breathing and was half unconscious. The nurse told them to sit down even though she could see she was struggling with him resting his head on her shoulder. She didn’t even help to get him to the chair. She told the nurse I’m struggling and he will fall. That fell to deaf ears. Absolutely disgusting! Where is the compassion in nursing. Appalling she didn’t care if he fell to the floor but wouldn’t help him to the chair

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: GP consultation
body: Face to Face. Apart from running 20mins late, the consultation was very thorough. She introduced herself and apologised for the delay. She was very pleasant and explained everything very clearly.

title: Endless issues
body: Have been with this GP for a number of years, endless issues from rude and unhelpful reception staff to GP's who don't listen nor seem to care in the slightest and that is if you are lucky enough to be able to get an appointment. All the good GP's all seem to have left the practice and the locums just don't seem to care and don't bother looking at your history or even listening to you about what the issue is. Have now moved to another practice and wouldn't recommend them at all nor will I ever use them again.

title: Absolutely horrible
body: Had to come out after. Been in for a lot of hours and staff weren’t to helpful and a lot of abuse going on felt uncomfortable

title: Shockingly poor in the last few years
body:
This used to be a good GP practice, but in 2019 I noticed the turnover in GPS increase and the idea of putting the patient first has gone swiftly downhill. The system of communication has meant in the last week, to get a routine repeat prescription, I had three attempts to communicate online, a total of 10 text messages from a 3 different doctors and a pharmacist, four phone calls with the GP receptionist until eventually I now have 2/3 of my repeat prescription. The system for booking an appointment to see a nurse or a doctor is dreadful. You have to be determined, because if you don’t contact them before 10am - either by waiting in a phone queue or logging in online, then the system is full. If you try to make a less urgent appointment for a future date, you can’t because, the cut-off date is 3 weeks away.
I have noticed mistakes happening and increased meanness when it comes to writing out prescriptions for my child’s eczema treatment. After my last HRT check (which they insist is every 3 months now, rather than every 6) I had a text telling me  to make an additional appointment just to check my blood pressure. 
They insist the system is to make patient care more efficient, but I can’t believe it’s more efficient for the GPs. And it’s a hell of a lot more hard work for patients.

title: 21 people in A&E, 8.5 hour waiting time
body:
I've been here since 2300 it is currently 0605, bloods were taken at midnight, I was originally given a time of 1.5 hours, then 6 and now 8.5hrs. 

I fear that this time will increase further. I am not confident that I will be seen before 1000. 

This is a bit ridiculous.

title: Kind
body: I have been going to western house quite a lot in the past few years. I've seen a lot of different people there and whilst the mental health services could be improved, there are always kind receptionists and people to talk to. They have always looked after me, even when I couldn't myself. Thank you.

readBy.name: Essex Partnership University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant doctors and practice
body: I have belonged to the practice for many years and have never been disappointed.  The care and attention is second to none.  I can honestly say that any health concerns I have had over the years have been dealt with fast, sympathetically and with the utmost professionalism.  I would thoroughly recommend. Thank you.

title: Disgusting
body:
The way I was treated when I attending the surgery by the receptionist was absolutely disgusting!! They are rude, think they are the doctors and do not care for the patients one bit!!
I advice people away and am also looking at getting a new surgery...
Doctors good, receptionists a joke!!

title: Fantastic service
body:
We visited Wansbeck walk in centre on a Saturday evening with my son who had hurt his foot. We were seen within less than half an hour by a lovely nurse and sent promptly for an x ray. 
Everything was explained clearly and they took great care of my son who was in a lot of pain.
The whole trip lasted less than an hour before we were on our way home. We were given comprehensive after care advice before we left.
The staff were all so kind and helpful. Keep up the great work!. Thankyou.

title: Good practice
body: When I entered the staff were very polite and helpful and advised me what I needed to do for my appointment.

title: Fantastic service
body: I rang because i ran out my medication im in Manchester at the moment staying with my daughter as im having some treatment at the Christie hospital I explained to lady on the phone I felt she went above her duty to help me she got a doctor to ring me and less than 24 hrs my prescription was at boots on knutsford high street thank you castle Donington surgery brilliant service

title: Great surgery
body: From reception team to the Doctors I’ve found them to be extremely polite and helpful. Quickly seen and any issues have always been quickly sorted.

author: stonewg76
title: Excellent GP Services
body:
I am writing this story for two reasons, firstly, Glendermott Medical Practice has always provided a gold star, GP service to me and my family for the last 27 years. Secondly, because I am fed up of hearing people complaining about not being able to see their GP and criticising the Doctors as if they are sitting in the practice twiddling their thumbs, doing no work when they are as stretched as every part of the health service is at the moment!  
I have always been able to get through to the practice on the telephone to book appointments (though it takes patience) and have been seen face to face during the pandemic when the doctor feels it is appropriate. The practice staff even organized and vaccinated my elderly, mother-in-law for covid when she was staying here from England during the pandemic (before her HSC registration was threw), in case she missed her vaccination and became ill. They were very kind and welcoming to her for those 9 months, providing all her prescribed medicines.  
Recently, Glendermott have 're-opened' their practice and are having routine face-to-face appointments again. However, i feel some conditions could be managed or reviewed by telephone appointments so i hope this will be an option for people with mobility, transport issues and those who have difficulty getting out of work. I don't want to name all the staff who have been outstanding in their work but I feel the reception and telephonist staff deserve a special mention as they face a lot of unnecessary abuse and rudeness while just doing their jobs.

title: Waste of time
body: This is my second experience of using this service within 3 years and it was useless and stressful both times. You can tell they are simply following a data input and reading out the instructions - there appears to be no listening to the patient or divergent from their script. I was trying to avoid a long wait time in A&E for my grandparent who’d injured their arm and requested the 2 hour urgent care referral which the NHS website said we qualified for and just to phone 111. Instead I was told we didn’t qualify and to go to a walk-in centre. I said we would go to one in the south of the city as I know they have a huge range of facilities and departments. But the 111 person insisted we go to a different centre because that’s what the screen was telling them. When I refused, they made me feel like I was going to be in trouble and said they’d have to pass me to their supervisor because I was potentially putting my grandparent at risk! I said I wasn’t refusing him treatment, I was simply going to the south centre rather than the one they said. Long story short, I went to the centre they told me to where, lo and behold, they didn’t have the facilities to deal with the injury. From there we were referred somewhere else and basically 6 hours and 3 walk-in centres later, we ended up at the south centre that I originally wanted to go to because they were the only one that had the facilities we needed. It’s an absolute joke. Even the doctor at the centre commented how terrible 111 are and that they spend a lot of time redirecting patients elsewhere due to 111 not getting it right. My poor elderly grandparent spent a lot of unnecessary time in pain and discomfort.

title: Really Grateful
body:
Your Review:  Hello Willow Bank,

I would like to send a massive thank you to a staff member that has gone far and beyond for me across the last two weeks.

Whilst travelling I've been unable to contact the surgery directly to find out what's happened with my blood results and decided to email. From day 1, the team member responded with so much patience and reassurance that she was looking into it and would send an update with the progress. Across today, it became difficult to determine when the blood test would be available and she took it upon herself to contact the specific blood area and make sure that all my results would be available for the spinal team in a few days' time.

I understand how busy your team is and I can't thank your staff member for going far and beyond to follow up on results directly with the blood team and provide me with the peace of mind knowing it's all ready for me.

Sometimes it's the little things and actions like this that mean so much.

Willow bank, you have a great team. 

Thanks again.

title: A pleasant experience
body: I attended the hospital on Saturday 4th March, to undergo a basal cell carcinoma operation. From walking in the entrance to being discharged same day I have nothing but praise for everyone I came into contact with, from start to end. Their friendliness and professionalism put me at ease, the op was a great success, and I was offered coffee, biscuits, toast and juice on several occasions. This is a good hospital with fantastic, caring and hardworking staff. Thank you Wythenshawe Hospital!

title: Great care and understanding
body: Recently spent quite a lot of time at King's Mill where my mother recently lost her battle with Cancer. The treatment she received on ward 24 during her final days was fantastic and all the staff made her and our family as comfortable and cared for as possible during what was an extremely difficult time. Also a few days after her passing her husband was also admitted to ward 36 which also gave fantastic care to him with great understanding of the situation particularly one of your Health Care Assistants who went above and beyond to help him cope with the situation as well as his health condition. Massive thanks from all the family x.

title: Disappointment
body: Having been a patient at this practice for over 60 years, I am very disappointed with the present situation; I am not able to contact them by 'phone (always in a queue) so decided to pop into Chiseldon surgery to make an appointment, only to be told '' we don't take appointment bookings here anymore''!  Time for a change I think.

title: Great Practice
body:
I went to the Hallamshire Endoscopy Dpt yesterday.
I was a little nervous as I have never had one before. 
The staff nurse who took my details and fitted a canula was very friendly. When I was taken through to have the endoscopy everyone was so happy and put me at ease immediately. I was given a light sedative and  can honestly say I don't remember much about the procedure!
I was given the result straight away too.
Thank you all for making the experience so good.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Staff is reliable, on time, helpful, considerate, caring. The nurse who took my blood was very gentle and understood my fear of blood

title: Wonderful staff and treatment
body:
Yesterday my sister and I attended this department with our 97 year old father. He had an infection, which he has experienced before. He told us about it that same morning, therefore we unfortunately had no option but to use the service on a Saturday morning. 
The whole department was amazing - from initial reception to the final assessment and treatment we were treated efficiently and in a calm, polite and pleasant way.  Although it was very busy we were in and out in under an hour - fantastic. 
Thankyou so much to you all.

title: always unable to contact the practice
body: i needed to either email or arrange appointment with the practice - i work like everyone else, so to find that the so-called "klinik service" is disabled at the weekend and that there is no email either to leave is disgraceful - if you thought it was bad before the change of management, its way worse now - the fact that even during hours yoy cannot call and book an appointment any more is ridiculous! not all people can or want to fill in some stupid online form that does not give the option of you putting the info you want, plus surely thus now becomes data protection issue as we dont know who is actually reading the info on these forms. it could be anyone and my data is for my GP only, not anyone who happens to read the forms

title: Awful practice
body: It's impossible to get an appointment with them.  The receiptionists are very unprofessional and rude.

title: Very poor service
body:
Unable to get a face to face GP appointment at all. Phone back appointments are promised and do not happen.
I have to travel to the surgery as the phone queue is so long, 40+ waiting last time i tried to ring.
To get a phone call back from a GP you have to attend the surgery in person early in the morning, this is after i have tried to phone and still get fobbed off. it is a black farce.. Meanwhile, i am still in pain..

title: Attentive practice
body: Personal attentive interaction between professionals and patient. Efficacious and reassuring with progressive outcome

title: Taking care of my needs
body: The Practice Pharmacist contacted me to ask me if I wanted to transfer on to the electronic prescription service to make ordering and collection easier for me. This should make it more straight forward.

title: Great service, great experience, great outcome
body: I referred myself to Croydon Talking Therapies because I’ve always been a bit anxious but a couple of life events meant this spiralled out of control. I referred myself and I’d had an assessment within a couple of days - and referred for CBT within a week. The sessions themselves were helpful, and tailored to my personal situation. I felt seen and heard and I made such good progress in the time I was there. I felt much better when I came to the end of my treatment and prepared to deal with life as it happens but also convinced that I can re-refer if necessary. Thank you!

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent service
body: I attended A and E at 4am this morning with dizziness. The staff could not have been more helpful and efficient in all the departments I was taken to especially when they had been working all night. Congratulations to them all.

readBy.name: Northern Lincolnshire and Goole NHS Foundation Trust

title: 1st visit
body:
Fast and excellent response from initial phone call to triage through to getting appointments and treatment within 6hours
Excellent!

author: februaryrm49
title: Dentist made me feel comfortable
body: I have both positive and negative experiences but as far as healthcare in the prison where I am its mostly positive, especially the dentist! With the dentist she made me comfortable and carried out the work without discomfort.

author: Mis helps
title: Staff bend over backwards
body:
I would like to praise the staff at Langworthy medical centre they are fantastic and helpful every time I have phoned they bend over backwards for me.  
Love them all.

author: Old lad
title: Helpful information
body: I had a routine blood pressure test and I thought it was a little too high so I asked to see a doctor and after that consultation I had an ECG then I was put on a course of medication and was sent a booklet about type 2 diabetes. That’s where I am at the moment, on medication for angina and helpful information on diet to try and lower cholesterol and diabetes levels.

title: Very knowledgeable
body: The specialist  was very friendly, knowledgeable, and comforting  and gave me hope  that he could help me with  my issues.

title: One eye done - can't wait to have the second done
body:
Very professional, capable, knowledgeable and informative. Five days between consultation and operation. I was even offered a choice of times for the very quick procedure of cataract replacement. 
I cannot rate this practice highly enough - every last member of staff were very, very pleasant, knew their job and responsibilities and treated everybody as a welcome and valued individual. 
The whole procedure was fascinating and totally without pain or discomfort of any sort. My surgeon even told me what he was doing as he replaced my lens during the procedure which I found very reassuring. 
The discharge process was quick and efficient with all the information I needed to medicate the affected eye. I was at home within two hours (just)  of leaving home. 
Although I had to keep the eye covered with a transparent patch until the following morning it was no more than a minor inconvenience. I had no problem sleeping with it in place. 
The following day I had a lens removed from my glasses and my sight was sufficient to easily meet the requirements of the DVLA though it was a day later that I drove again without any problem. 
I bought a pair of cheap, off-the-peg reading glasses to use until my sight finally settles down after the second eye is done. 
Even now, there is no administrative work I need to do. The interaction between SpaMedica, my optician and myself will happen without me having to initiate anything. 
Overall, a very good experience with absolutely no adverse criticism at all. Oh! And enjoying better colour perception in the 'new eye.'
SpaMedica - thank you very much indeed!

title: Incredible staff
body:
I had to go to the Urgent care unit after coughing up blood; reception staff, clinical care staff, nurses, x-ray, doctors and consultant… every single person I encountered was kind, patient and helpful.
I’m not very good at having bloods done so when they couldn’t find a vein, I panicked for the worst. The staff were incredible. So patient and understanding, tried many times all while being sympathetic to my phobia and giving me simple tricks to help them. It ended up being a consultant inserting a cannula but even my assigned doctor stayed with me to make sure I was ok and to reassure me, sharing my relief and gratitude when it was in. I knew it was what needed to happen but everyone totally understood my emotional responses and took them in their stride with good grace and patience.
Thankfully it wasn’t an overnight stay and even my discharge nurse removed my cannula while keeping me calm. They explained about my prescription and even advised local pharmacies open late on a Sunday.
Aside from the needle phobia, the staff kept me up to date and totally in the loop on why everything was happening and the different outcomes that could occur with pneumonia. Total transparency that kept me at ease and reassured the whole time.
A horrible situation for me was made much easier thanks to the incredible staff. Thanks so much!

title: Great care
body: My husband was rushed to A&E in ambulance during his routine health check. The ambulance service looked after him and answered all our concerns until he was taken inside A&E in HDU. We are very grateful for the great care provided to my husband by the lovely gentlemen who looked after my husband in the ambulance to the doctors and nurses who took great care of him. My husband is now being treated as an outpatient in the same hospital. Thank you for everything you do in looking after all the patients.

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Great extra clinic
body: The surgery provided a weekend clinic for cervical smears. This is something that many women choose to ignore but the weekend Clinic means that it is an accessible service for all. The nurse was lovely, efficient and understanding. She also explained everything extremely well. Thank you

title: Amazing service
body: I was dealt with promptly and respectively. I felt at ease the whole time I was there and left feeling content. I would be happy to go there again in the future if I need anyother treatment.

title: Has potential to be fantastic
body:
This practice can be amazing or dreadful (the latter is such a shame).  Everyone has bad days but when you are employed in a position to help people with health issues, pain, concerns etc. understanding is required.

You don't shout a patient down, or speak sarcastically to them when they have very genuine concerns.  A quick look at the patient's health record (always available) will soon confirm that they have a genuine reason to contact the surgery.  After all, no one wants to have health issues.

I think there are two main issues with Central Surgery:

One is when a patient has multiple health issues and requires regular follow-up and monitoring.  I appreciate there will be many things to keep on top of in these situations; however, I understand that there are wonderful ITsystems in place that can facilitate this.

The other issue is that the practice is managed by business people.  How could a business person with no medical experience be expected to understand how patients might be feeling and the patients' particular concerns?  

The above is not a criticism; however it needs to be addressed, because that attitude goes right down the line (e.g. to trainees etc.)

The amazing Clinical and Admin staff who actually take the time to go the extra mile for us patients are victims of their own success - as they are the people who are repeatedly recommended.

I once asked how I could contact one of the Partner GPs and was advised I wouldn't be able to do that directly as it had to go through Admin.  That is not acceptable.  

My concern was genuine, potentially urgent and was in connection with ongoing health issues.  With all due respect, that situation should not (at any time) be triaged by a member of staff who is not medically trained.  Those rules could be a recipe for an unfortunate result at some point.

Come on Central Surgery.  The more of us you can get on your side, the more we can work with you (and any business person will know that).

Thank you for taking the time to read this, although I doubt it will get through the filters and be published.

title: Awful service
body: I came to the surgery with symptoms of tonsillitis I told the doctor I might have tonsillitis she totally disregarded this didn’t even check if possibly was tonsillitis, she just quickly checked my ear and throat and asked me to call my dentist, I then went to my dentist who advised me to go back to the doctors as he was certain I did have tonsillitis, I then had to go to North Tees Urgent Care who checked properly and prescribed me with the correct medication. This is surgery is pointless and a waste of time the doctor was clearly in a rush to be elsewhere, I will be leaving this surgery effective immediately

title: Good practice
body: Very happy with the day staff we feel that the care drops of an evening and the family are relied on heavily waiting times after help buzzer are pressed are a little bit to long. It’s Sunday 05th of March 2023. The day team looking after my Mum in E2, have been exceptional. With the care and understanding of my Mother.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: A&E Operational notes Sdec
body:
Re visit 
Dear  Member
Overall, I thought my recent experience was good. Even thought the wait was 6.5 hours, I can live with that as the NHS is in turmoil and disarray with strikes and doctor shortages etc.
But, here’s the thing. Why was I asked to leave my vulnerable 76 year old wife alone, whilst awaiting treatment in the Sdec 1st floor waiting area, and move to the general ground floor waiting area. 
(This is a person who always needs an advocate during any treatment or consultation)
Valuable information is now missing during treatment and consultation, causing unnecessary delays in a satisfactory outcome and further expense to the NHS.
Name of the overly assertive nurse who ordered this action around 8am.03/04/23 withheld 
Any comments?

title: it's not a hospital, it's a prison
body: coming here I wanted to get help and I feel only worse many times I was ignored here by the staff zero going out for a cigarette once an hour and it's your only contact with nature and I won't even mention food

title: Worrying long waiting time
body: My mum has been referred to the respiratory clinic in October 2022 and she still hasn’t received a date for appointment, her condition is getting deteriorating and we are getting worried. Rang reception twice, the call was handled by a rude, disrespectful woman who hung up on her saying she doesn’t know when she’ll get an appointment. Terrible service!

title: So happy with the speed of care & expertise
body: My 26 year old daughter was referred to A&E after calling 111 She was seen immediately, literally within 2 minutes of arriving and a bed was found within 2 hours. She was seen by a doctor & monitored by the doctor and 3 nurses whilst waiting. They were kind, reassuring, caring and capable. She had surgery the next day and the doctor even called her at home after discharge to check on her, give her test results and further reassure her. Exemplary! The A&E department at 11pm on the Sunday night was busy but calm and seems everyone was seen reasonably quickly. I cannot praise our NHS enough

title: Appointment
body: Spend a lot of time at QMC all I can say is nothing has been to much trouble lovely staff carry on the great work and Thank you all

title: Poor practice
body: I have copd and lungcancer to get an appointment or prescription is really difficult my opticians sent a request for eye drops to be put on repeat prescription for me and after asking at reception told its there waiting for a gp to sign it that was sent nearly 3weeks ago. In the past I have had to contact macmillian for help in getting me an appointment  when my breathing , pain etc is really bad

title: Great service and attention
body: Clean, welcoming staff, reassuring, great food and choices plenty of care and attention . From first consultation to the day of operation, plenty of information about procedures, choices available. Continuing checks through out stay ,maintaining dignity and respect. Excellent

title: Great nurse
body: Very Friendly staff and the nurse was very nice and help full . The nurse explain everything very well.

title: Delay of nebuliser treatment
body: My daughter was admitted to A and E with her COPD stage 4 breathing problems then transferred to Ward 2 and left without nebuliser treatment until a complaint was made to staff. Terrible treatment.

readBy.name: Milton Keynes University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

author: Merle Wren
title: Excellent care received at A&E
body:
My elderly mother had a bad fall on Monday and sustained numerous injuries from head to toe.  
Although we had a bit of a wait to be seen once we were taken into the department mum was treated primarily by Dr McDonald. He was truly amazing. He examined mum from head to toe, arranged all necessary tests and then attended to the numerous wounds.  
He was kind, polite, respectful and considerate and understanding. Anyone who found themselves in an unfortunate situation would be extremely lucky to come across Dr McDonald in their time of need.  
Other members of the A&E and the wider departments were also great.

author: conditionergx96
title: They made my experience the best possible
body:
So I arrived at 7:30am to be ready for my operation on reconstruction of the ankle, bone removal and ligament repair.  
I was greeted by a lovely woman called Morag at Stobhill. She was more than accommodating for myself, making sure I had what I need pre and post op and making my experience the best as possible, as before I was nervous due to external factors.  
However afterwards she looked after me, but the pain is just so sore. Over all I’m okay tho and having a blast.

readBy.name: Office of John Mason, MSP for Glasgow Shettleston

author: Kish
title: Heart surgery and telehealth
body: After the heart surgery my health has improved, whereby I don't get tired now after walking for one kilometre. I like to do work rather than sitting.

author: Possom
title: Outpatient hysteroscopy
body:
There are campaigns going on all over England against painful outpatient hysteroscopies. It has been debated in parliament nine times over the past eight years. I feel the NHS is being less than honest, telling women the pain will be just like period pains.  
It is reported that 1 in 3 women experience severe pain but you are not told this. I knew before the procedure as I had a biopsy before but not the added pain of the camera. You are advised to take paracetomol beforehand which is a mild pain-kilker and was ineffective for severe pain. I have a high pain threshold, but the pain was awful and many women have to have the procedure stopped due to severe pain. I feel it is nothing short of a scandal that women are still being put through this.  
The hospital I went to offered no other pain relief besides advising to take paracetomol beforehand. This needs to change. You need strong pain relief for this procedure as it is an operative procedure. Women should not be told that the pain will just be period like and the NHS should offer stronger pain relief and sedation. You are offered sedation for colonoscopy, and other endoscopies so why not for this procedure?

author: velayw39
title: So many lovely staff, but one was off
body:
I have visited and been treated at St Cross this week, regarding a suspected blood clots post c-section ( 11 days).  
Initially I was sent to urgent care centre. Unfortunately they couldn't treat me, the staff were very kind and helpful.  
I then went to the DVT clinic the following day - staff absolutely amazing! Especially Geraldine so kind and caring! Made me at ease! The whole team are lovely, made me a scan appointment which was for today.  
Found the scanning department, receptionist & scan assistant were lovely, unfortunately the main scanner I found uncaring & rude. I was in a severe amount of pain & felt like I was made to feel a nuisance. Gutted really as everyone else was exceptional.  
My scan unfortunately came back as blood clots. I was then sent back to the DVT clinic who again were amazing. Helped me understand my medication and assured me I would be ok.  
Nothing bad to say. Also the volunteers that work there are amazing too! Always on hand to help patients. One kind volunteer helped me walk to the other side off the hospital. She was lovely and reassured me.  
Apart from the one off staff today it is an amazing hospital with brilliant staff and outstanding care. Thanks again to all that helped me.

author: Meandmesh
title: Hospital@Home saved a hospital stay
body:
My mother of 93 yrs had a nasty chest infection and GP wanted her to go into hospital to which she flatly refused. Hospital@home took over her care, allowing her to stay in her own home and receiving care as she would have in hospital.  
The service was fast and efficient. She was thoroughly assessed at home and all tests and treatment arranged for her. The nurses were lovely, friendly caring individuals, who communicated and kept us informed at all times. As a family we felt reassured and confident in the expertise and knowledge of the whole team.  
Mum has now recovered fully. It saved any unnecessary hospital stay and meant she could be managed in her own environment where she felt comfortable.  
Sincere thanks to all involved. What a fantastic service!

author: Chrissybim
title: Having my breast removed
body:
I had a mastectomy 15 years ago on my right breast and I was in hospital for a week until my drain was removed.  
I was well treated but nursed as a very sick patient.  
When I had my left breast removed this Thursday because of another tumour it was so different.  
The day ward was relaxed and friendly and all the persons involved in my treatment came to see me and check I knew what was happening.  
When I woke I could not believe that it was all over. I knew nothing and had to ask if it was done.  
I then had a cup of tea and the most delicious sandwich on the ward.  
The staff from the surgeon to the University student nurse were wonderful.  
I went home that day elated that it had all gone so well. I am still getting wonderful aftercare.  
Thank you all for giving me my life back.

author: papadh77
title: Head injury led to my drink and drugs habit
body:
My life fell apart when I suffered a bad head injury. It happened because while being on tag I had climbed out of a first floor window and got stuck upside-down. Yeah, how funny, you think but not for me. How was I going to get out of this f* up I thought. Then the idea came to me: I would just unhook myself, not far to drop. But it was, and I was upside-down.  
The next thing, I found myself wondering why my head was sticking to the pillow and why I was in hospital, but I did find out what was sticking to the pillow: it was a big staple in my head and there was more of them. So for the next hour it was my mission to get them out of my head and I did get one or two out but it made a mess on the pillow with blood out of my head and one of the nurses seen it and went mad at me.  
Anyway, since then I don't have much of a memory. I forget everything so now I just want to drink and take drugs to forget how stupid I am. But it's a very lonely place and I always end up on my own.  
And that's me, still here with my bad memories, getting drunk and taking drugs and thanks for taking the time to read my story. Be lucky, bye now.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: lovely food
body:
I was transferred from Craigavon to Lurgan hospital a week or two ago. The ambulance brought me over.  
The staff are all incredible, lovely team of nurses and doctors.  
The cleaning staff are also really friendly. The food is just lovely, I had a lovely dessert tonight after my dinner as well. The ward is beautiful, absolutely shining.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The care has been very good
body:
The care has been very good since coming in to Lurgan. Both Craigavon and Lurgan are great hospitals and I've been looked after very well by both.  
I will say I think it's easier to get rest in Lurgan hospital just due to the fact its a lot quieter and I was having to deal with a lot of noise during the night over in Craigavon.  
The food is first class, variety on the menu is great. Haven't got any problems at all.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Very friendly nurses
body:
The staff are so nice, all the nurses are so friendly and have really put me at ease.  
The food has been okay, I enjoyed everything today that I ordered but my appetite just isn't too good at the minute.  
The cleaners do a very well done job, the place is gleaming. I wouldn't make any changes to my stay I have been well treated.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shagq75
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Male medical has been such a good ward
body:
Male medical has been overall a good place to recover. I hope I am not in much longer but I am in the right place to get better. The bed space is clean and I feel hygienic, I was expecting to feel unclean.  
The staff are great. They have great people skills and are very approachable. I do not think they get enough credit for what they do.  
Male medical has been such a good ward.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: yankeezk59
title: Poor communication at surgery
body:
Requested a blood pressure check early Dec, repeat blood pressure record chart - blood pressure in the normal range. Follow up - cholesterol level too high. I had a phone call discussion appointment - the outcome was a 3 month repeat blood test and life style change and a repeat blood test booked for end of March.  
I received a message from GP again requesting annual review. I explained my previous test results and still waiting for my annual review. GP advised to cancel blood test and they would test me in surgery. I had to explain to 3 staff before they realized I was right to stick to the booked test/ pending cholesterol level/also border line thyroid level.  
For me this shows a total lack of information sharing among practice staff and as everyone is over stretched a waste of their own time and irritating to the patient. My suggestion is one message for annual review two for repeat and one call to discuss the outcome .  
[Unsure about 'Reception']

author: leoxq75
title: Repeat prescriptions and appointment system
body: The system for requesting and repeat prescription has changed without warning or notice. The system for booking appointments has changed to frequently. Both are impossible to now use as the options on the econsult form do not cover repeat prescription and they have never been any choices for issues I wish to speak to my GP about.

author: Pezet
title: Awful service
body:
You can't get an appointment, you can't speak to a person (if you follow their appointments system and choose the option relevant to you).  
I'm in need of check-in with my GP and I can't get through. I'm on medication that requires periodic check-ins and dose adjustments and it's impossible to achieve with them.

author: HelpmeXXXX
title: 111 triage for emergency dentist
body: Complete time wasting. Call handler didn't know what they were doing and asked ridiculous questions to assess the situation. Didn't ask if the patent was in pain and made an assumption that they weren't. Didn't say they would refer the patient and tried to finish the call without giving any information other than what's written on the script. More training needed for the call handler!

author: magpiewy78
title: Confusing appointment
body:
I attend the local dermatology clinic and well basically at my last appointment I was very confused, I thought I was attending to discuss the lumps on my chest and neck – I never did. Instead, the two nurses made it clear to me that they did not have a clue why I was there and after looking at my list of tablets they just seemed to want to discuss that I was taking isotretinoin and had been doing so for four years!  
It was their opinion that I should stop taking those tablets now, but I feel that they are doing the job and my skin is quite clear because of them – it is very confusing. As I said my original issues – the lumps were never discussed.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: geminidj53
title: Unacceptable service
body:
My wife was supposed to have telephone consultation with a psychiatrist, this has so far been changed 5 times. We saw that an appointment in the afternoon had been made for us and we have been notified by email the same day. We were outside and did not have access to emails, and did not see the email in time to attend the appointment and therefore we missed the call.  
This is unacceptable. My wife needs a face-to-face appointment not missed or changed telephone consultations!

author: Cloughreagh
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: It felt like a nice quiet holiday
body:
I came to Cloughreagh house from hospital. It felt like a nice quiet holiday. I was looked after well with no complaints. It was very peaceful, clean, up to date accommodation. Staff were very friendly. The food was good with a nice variety and portions were enough. They had a good choice of hot and cold drinks throughout my stay. I feel I was treated in a very courteous way staff always listened and took my views into account.  
The rehab team - physio and OT worked with me to get me ready to go home. I had a fall when OT was working with me but staff here came to help me quickly and made sure I was alright

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Bowserjr88
title: No available contraception appointments
body:
I realised the other day that my contraceptive implant was due to be removed a few weeks ago so I went online to find out how I can have this removed and a new one placed. The nhs Scotland website informed me that I could book an appointment online or call the number given. I attempted to book online but it said there were no appointments available online and to call. So I done this. I waited for 45 minutes only to go from queue position 10 to 5 only to be cut off as the automated system said they could not take the call and hung up.  
This morning I spent one hour and ten minutes on hold only to get through to a person who then told me no sorry there’s no appointments available you’ll have to try again on Monday.  
This isn’t acceptable. In the last two days I have spent over two hours on hold, I do not have time to do this again next week only to be told the same thing again. While I understand the pressures the NHS is under, I require healthcare and have no access to it. It’s not good enough quite frankly.

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Staff are so attentive and are doing the best they possibly can!
body:
The care have received in Lurgan is second to none. All the staff are so attentive and are doing the best they possibly can.  
The food is decent, I have actually become more fond of it this past while.  
The cleaners are excellent, the ward is kept very clean and tidy.  
I don't see any need for change, where I'm concerned I think everything is great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Matdw53
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff were brilliant!
body:
The care in 1 North has been alright so far but I am definitely feeling a lot better since I was admitted as I couldn't really remember anything after my heart attack.  
The staff were brilliant from the moment I came in and have always been so nice and explain any tests they run or the medications that they use which I appreciate as it's nice to know what's happening.  
The food is decent its just the variety it hasn't changed since I came in which I feel is something that needs a bit of change

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: soiljf49
title: They are all such caring people
body:
I was a patient in the Day Surgery Unit towards the end of February for surgery to my shoulder.  
I cannot thank all the staff enough for the care and attention they gave me, it was excellent. Staff Nurse Steven was brilliant as was the Night Staff Nurse Alli.  
They are all such caring people. Every time they passed my room they would pop their heads in to check that that I was OK and not needing anything. They are all a credit to their profession and I would like to thank them all most sincerely.  
Thank you.

title: Impossible to get appointments
body: Very difficult to get appointments. Had to wait for 2 days for my kid to be checked in person. Do not have enough front office staff to attend calls and very few GPs / doctors to the population they serve.

title: Poor service
body: Response times on the phone are really long. I couldn't book a doctor after trying to phone in every day for a week. Eventually I has to go to an emergency walk in centre. The one appointment I did book with a nurse I ended up waiting 40 minutes because the receptionist did not book me in properly. Based on this I wouldn't recommend this surgery.

author: Pollyanna1403
title: Nurses went above and beyond
body:
I had to go into the cardiology day unit to have a CT Scan. I also had to take medication to slow my heart rate and a patch to open all blood vessels.  
This made me very unwell and the nurses in the ward went above and beyond to ensure I was okay. My blood pressure dropped dramatically and I had to stay with them a while longer.  
So I was offered tea and a sandwich which was gratefully accepted.

author: tauruscz78
title: My 25th Donation
body:
The staff made me feel very comfortable returning to donate after the period over covid.  
The new donation chairs are comfortable for the time you're in them. All the staff are pleasant, attentive and knowledgeable.  
Apparently, the appointment system for blood donation came about following the social distancing requirements during the pandemic.  
It seems efficient, but I wonder if the extra step is reducing attendances more generally.  
The platelet donors opposite me were being looked after admirably as well.  
Great to have free parking on site.

author: Agnes49
title: I felt that this was handled unprofessionally
body: My relatives neighbour phoned me to inform me that they had 6/7 months to live and had been admitted to Ward 1, Durham University Hospital. I phoned and told a staff member what I had been told by the neighbour. Their response was, well we all have to die sometime. I was in shock at their response and really upset. I felt that this was handled unprofessionally.

author: Danmz93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: If you put in the work it can be achieved 100% - I'm living proof!
body:
For me, the groups really helped me so much as not only does it give you something to do, to focus on it also gives you a purpose and helps you discuss with other service users ways of getting through in the early days.  
I've been in recovery for over 10 months now and I can honestly say that participating in groups and touching base with my key worker it has enabled me to overcome my drinking.  
In the early days Relapse Prevention and Alcohol Groups, really helped, then I went into Women's Group, where we as women helped each other. I'm now training to be a Peer Mentor to help other overcome addictions if you put in the work it can be achieved 100%  
I'm living proof!  
Thank you ORB

author: Danmz93
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I feel like there's always someone to listen if I need to talk
body:
The services are always understanding and really put me at ease.  
I feel like there's always someone to listen if I need to talk, and any problems I have are always taken seriously and are helped to the best of peoples abilities.

author: Amity-Rose
title: Lacks continuity of care
body:
Despite working around the ethos of 'your support your way', this does not apply to the provision of care at the Arran centre. I feel the type and level of care is formulated around an established framework designed for the benefit of staff and perhaps some patients. As a result of this I feel continuity of care does, to a great extent, not exist and significant changes to mental health needs are therefore not recognised and not followed up.  
When I became a patient of the Arran centre over a year ago, I asked at my initial meeting with my psychiatrist about having a CPN, a service I has received for several years. This request was laughed off with the response ,what do you need a CPN for? I have great personal issues of trust with psychiatric services which is warranted and documented. I have made it clear that I do not like talking to lots of different people and when I was informed that if I had issues I was to call the duty nurse or crisis team. I made it very clear I was not comfortable with this care plan to which I was told, thats how we do it here. What part of that statement suggests your support your way.  
Calling different people often strangers has been exceptionally difficult for me, making me feel vulnerable and afraid at times for my own safety. Psychiatrist appointments are not given in advance, when you speak with your psychiatrist you have no idea when your next appointment will be. I have also stated this does not sit well with me as I stay well by being extremely organised in my life. This to me is not organised as I cannot consider whether an issue can wait till my next appointment as I have no idea when it is.  
Recently my mood has been very unstable precipitated by environmental factors. While my psychitrist has kindly contacted housing services, I have had little input from the centre except when I call. Due to the way I feel about cold calling and feeling the need to constantly explain and disclose information over and over I have decided that despite my current emotional state I can not and will not be making these cold calls again. I cannot cope with it. I don't trust anyone because I don't know anyone well enough. How do you divulge your darkest thoughts to a stranger and trust they will help you, you cant.  
Please let me add that the staff at the Arran centre are very kind, very caring and respectful but if you promote your support your way then please listen to what people say and don't just hear.

readBy.name: Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

title: Friendly and helpful
body: Don't always get through to someone on the phone and have had issues with speaking to the reception staff before with being told there is no way to see a doctor or no appointment booked for me (even when it's been booked via 111) But the doctors are fantastic, they always respond promptly and appropriately to all e consults and this is definitely the best and easiest way to contact them- everything I've asked to be looked into and every suggestion I've made has been listened to- I'm very pleased with this doctors surgery at the moment because I can't express how helpful they have been. I've only ever had an appointment in person for a blood test or an emergency so more often than not, I'm not actually seen in person but for me this works well as I'm quite busy. Sometimes I do think it would be better and easier to see someone in person however the doctors do always listen very well via the phone and will quickly prescribe medication or refer for further tests and appointments elsewhere which is great. I don't think not being seen in person is a fault of the doctors or the surgery as a whole, as I think it's a common situation across the Uk with doctors at the moment and they are stretched so thin- overall I'm happy at this doctors!

author: Sad old bloke who still misses our lovely daughter
title: Ultimately Coombehaven is a place of safety
body:
Despite the excellent food, this is not a place that anyone in their right mind would choose to go to. How did I go from the safety of my own home to this scary place? Well, I was arrested and whilst I was de-arrested after a brief admission to a general hospital, I was immediately sectioned and literally carried kicking and screaming in the middle of the night into an ambulance to take me to Coombehaven.  
The regime here is harsh but ultimately fair even if it does not seem that way at the time. Why was I taken to seclusion for 3 days for hanging onto the telephone when speaking to my wife? Why was I offered a binary choice of tablets or a forced injection in the backside, which I regard as a metaphoric rape. I don't need answers to these rhetorical questions as I know my mind was disturbed. Ultimately the staff here are doing one of the toughest jobs in the world and I have realised that they have the patent's best interests at heart, even if it does not seem that way at the time. They are quite literally guardian angels.  
I spent 3 weeks at Coombehaven. They were the toughest 3 weeks of my life. The first week, spent largely in solitary confinement, lost to my mind. Apparently I met my sister but I have literally no recollection of seeing her and couldn't recognise some of my notes from this period although I could see they were written in my own handwriting, albeit in the third person. The last 2 weeks were made much worse because I caught covid and hence had to spend a lot of time in my tiny room on my own.  
Ultimately I feel lucky because I have a loving family who support me and have been able to bring me home to continue my recovery. I recognise that most of the long term residents of the ward will not have this option. This is a desperate place where I found it very difficult to sleep even 2-3 hours a night. My sleep pattern remains disturbed and institutionalised to the point where I still wake at 0550 hours to get a shower and have breakfast because that was the way I escaped from my room in hospital.  
Ultimately Coombehavn is a place of safety for those for whom the alternative is somewhere extremely dark. It turned me around and so there is hope even amongst the chaos. Thank you to both shifts at Coombehaven for the under valued but simply extraordinary job you do.

author: Katetofu
title: I felt listened to and understood
body: The doctor was very kind, I felt listened to and understood and I was pleased to leave with a plan in place.

author: Harry23
title: Mental Health Care Service - Community Care Support
body:
I am a vulnerable adult with complex needs and receive full staff care, but I am also supported by the mental health service.  
I have had a poor level of service when it comes to the mental health service, where my tablets/medication are left at last minute or no communication at all made by the service to keep me/family updated on my medication at all, especially when they run out.  
I have to take my medication so I feel better, but often the case this is becoming an issue and area of concern as they will not be delivered in good time to avoid me panicking and causing me anxiety.  
[Very unhappy with 'Medication']

author: Apleased person
title: First class care for leg and foot problems
body:
I have attended Beachgrove wound clinic re a leg infection / sore bit.  
The attention I have received has been first class, easy access, treated well. Staff very easy to get on with. I would recommend treatment there anytime. Excellent.  
I have also been at podiatry PRI room six where I was treated really well by Vicky. Again excellent care for my foot problem.  
Thanks to all.  
[Very happy with 'Appointments']  
  
[Very happy with 'Transport']  
  
[Very happy with 'Reception']

readBy.name: Perth and Kinross Health & Social Care Partnership

author: MNM92
title: Good care for gallbladder surgery
body:
A few weeks ago I woke with horrific pain. After going to a&e at St John's and having CT and bloods done I was transferred to ward 106 at the Royal infirmary to see specialists and was due to have MRI and ultrasound as its was suspected gallstones.  
From arrival to discharge the care I received was incredible from my doctor, surgeon and nurses. Special shout to student nurses Heather (Y1) and Natasha (Y3) from Napier University who went above and beyond to make me happy and at ease.  
Operation for removal was smooth and went well. Now 3 weeks since my operation and healing very nicely. All the staff listened to me and all worked together to diagnose me and control my pain and I am so grateful.

author: Tibetan chants
title: Treated for breast cancer detected at screening
body:
I was recalled, having had my routine mammogram in October 2022.  
A very scary time, to be told I would need further treatment which eventually ended up having surgery for breast cancer in early February 2023.
